title: Google’s AlphaEvolve: The AI agent that reclaimed 0.7% of Google’s compute – and how to copy it
content: Google's AlphaEvolve is the epitome of a best-practice AI agent orchestration. It offers a lesson in production-grade agent engineering. Discover its architecture & essential takeaways for your enterprise AI strategy.

title: Shrink exploit windows, slash MTTP: Why ring deployment is now a must for enterprise defense
content: Ring deployment slashes MTTP and legacy CVE risk. Learn how Ivanti and Southstar Bank are modernizing patch strategy with real-time intel.

title: OpenAI launches research preview of Codex AI software engineering agent for developers — with parallel tasking
content: Starting today it will be available as a research preview for ChatGPT Pro, Enterprise, and Team users, with support later for Plus and Edu.

title: Acer unveils AI-powered wearables at Computex 2025
content: Acer Gadget, a subsidiary of Acer, unveiled AI-powered wearables at the Computex 2025 trade show in Taiwan.

title: The Download: the first personalized gene-editing drug, and Montana’s Right to Try experiment

title: Access to experimental medical treatments is expanding across the US
content: A couple of weeks ago I was in Washington, DC, for a gathering of scientists, policymakers, and longevity enthusiasts. They had come together to discuss ways to speed along the development of drugs and other treatments that might extend the human lifespan. One approach that came up was to simply make experimental drugs more easily…

title: Elon Musk’s xAI tries to explain Grok’s South African race relations freakout the other day
content: With its prompts now public and a team of human babysitters on call, Grok is supposedly back on script. But the incident underscores...

title: This baby boy was treated with the first personalized gene-editing drug
content: Doctors say they constructed a bespoke gene-editing treatment in less than seven months and used it to treat a baby with a deadly metabolic condition. The rapid-fire attempt to rewrite the child’s DNA marks the first time gene editing has been tailored to treat a single individual, according to a report published in the New…

title: The Download: Montana’s experimental treatments, and Google DeepMind’s new AI agent
content: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. The first US hub for experimental medical treatments is coming The news: A bill that allows clinics to sell unproven treatments has been passed in Montana. title: How US research cuts are threatening crucial climate data
content: Over the last few months, and especially the last few weeks, there’s been an explosion of news about proposed budget cuts to science in the US. One trend I’ve noticed: Researchers and civil servants are sounding the alarm that those cuts mean we might lose key data that helps us understand our world and how…
